text:
A Tense Confrontation

Dimly lit café, Raskolnikov and Zametov, tension rising.  
Raskolnikov: “What if I murdered the old woman?”  

Zametov: “Is it possible?”  
Raskolnikov: “Admit it, you believed it!”  
Zametov: “Not a bit! I believe it less!”  

---  

Café, Raskolnikov stands, shaking with anger.  
Raskolnikov: “What did you say behind my back?”  

Zametov: “Have you been frightening me?”  
Raskolnikov: “Where did my money come from?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts Zametov about the possibility of his involvement in the murders, revealing his inner turmoil and paranoia.
